channel.title: My first sig
channel.description:
my first photoshop sig, ever :P i used a background and a bit of a tut from pslovers but that was about it :P [IMG]http://img244.imageshack.us/img244/2305/wookerja6.jpg[/img] and heres another i just made :P, although i dont like it as much as the other one :P [img]http://img224.imageshack.us/img224/2528/dirkavq8.jpg[/img] both pretty much the same, in a way one i madeusing mr chris' tut [img]http://img213.imageshack.us/img213/657/dirkadirkakw4.jpg[/img] and my forums banner i made myself pretty big XD :) [img]http://img297.imageshack.us/img297/5004/dddtk7.jpg[/img]
but im just starting out so hopefully ill get better as i read a few more tuts :D[br][size=1]Posted at: November 20, 2006, 09:43:25 PM[/size][hr]added another sig and a banner :) please give CC guys

item.title: My first sig
item.dc:creator: @wooker wooker
item.description:
@wooker wrote:

Thanks for the comments guys I’ll definitely try a few sigs with a bit more light and colour. But first, I have to finish off this assignment that’s due tomorrow. On the last day of school. How ridiculous is that…

Read full topic

item.title: My first sig
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Wow, I love these. I just don’t know what it is about them. They look really quite good. Definitley, keep up the good work.

aorry not liking them they dont flow and they need some light

item.title: My first sig
item.dc:creator: @bob_lablah bob lablah
item.description:
@bob_lablah wrote:

If you want to blend you renders.Get out your lasso tool, set t feather with 20 px then go around the render roughly and then select inverse. then clcik delete it should blend it nicely

Read full topic

item.title: My first sig
item.dc:creator: @solemage2 solemage2
item.description:
@solemage2 wrote:

First 2, kinda too dark, Add some light to them
3rd, not shure that mg matches the render, and kinda hard to see the render
last one"banner" Not bad, the left sode is good, then as it moves to right right get a little to dark, done be afraid to add some color

Read full topic
